intro: Muraltia angulosa, commonly known as the angular muraltia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 3 meters, with thorny stems and small, clustered flowers. Its flowers are usually pale pink or white, and it produces small, angular pods that contain several seeds. Muraltia angulosa is often found in woodland and rocky habitats, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
